info.title: Shipment Tracking
info.description:
Merchants can use the PayPal Add Tracking API to manage tracking information. Merchants can add tracking numbers and associated information to PayPal. After adding these details to PayPal, merchants can:
  • Update tracking details.
  • Show tracking details.
  • Cancel tracking numbers.
For more information, see the Add Tracking API Overview and Add Tracking API Integration Guide.

post.summary: Add tracking information for multiple PayPal transactions
post.description: Adds tracking information, with or without tracking numbers, for multiple PayPal transactions. Accepts up to 20 tracking IDs. For more information, see Add tracking information with tracking numbers and Add tracking information without tracking numbers.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows tracking information.

400.description: The request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

403.description: The authorization failed due to insufficient permissions.

404.description: The specified resource does not exist.

500.description: An internal server error has occurred.

post.summary: Add tracking information for PayPal transaction
post.description: Adds tracking information for a PayPal transaction.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows tracking information.

get.description: Lists tracking information that meet search criteria. The tracking ID is required but the tracking number is optional.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that lists tracking information that meets search criteria.

put.summary: Update or cancel tracking information for PayPal transaction
put.description: Updates or cancels the tracking information for a PayPal transaction, by ID. To cancel tracking information, call this method and set the status to CANCELLED. For more information, see Update or cancel tracking information.

204.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 204 OK status code with no JSON response body.

get.description: Shows tracking information, by tracker ID, for a PayPal transaction.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows tracking information.

tags.name: trackers
tags.description: Use the `/trackers` resource to create and manage tracking information for PayPal transactions.

tags.name: trackers-batch
tags.description: Use the `/trackers-batch` resource to add tracking information for multiple PayPal transactions.

tags.name: carriers-recommend
tags.description: Use the `/carriers-recommendations` to detect the possible carriers corresponding the tracking info from tracking aggregator.

tags.name: carriers
tags.description: Use the `/carriers` resource to list/detect all the carriers available for tracking in PayPal and its subsidiary.

tags.name: shipments
tags.description: Use the `/shipments` resource to fetch all the shipments associated with a given Paypal Account Id.

transaction_id.name: transaction_id
transaction_id.description: Filters the tracking information that appears in the response by a PayPal transaction ID.

tracking_number.name: tracking_number
tracking_number.description: Filters the tracking information that appears in the response by a tracking number.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of the tracker in the transaction_id-tracking_number format.

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

tracking_status.title: Tracking Status
tracking_status.description: The status of the item shipment. For allowed values, see Shipping Statuses.

date_no_time.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.

carrier.title: Carrier
carrier.description: The carrier for the shipment. Some carriers have a global version as well as local subsidiaries. The subsidiaries are repeated over many countries and might also have an entry in the global list. Choose the carrier for your country. If the carrier is not available for your country, choose the global version of the carrier. If your carrier name is not in the list, set `carrier` to `OTHER` and set carrier name in `carrier_name_other`. For allowed values, see Carriers.

date_time.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this link, in [URI template format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570). Include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters for pre-processing. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

tracker.title: Tracker
tracker.description: The tracking information for a shipment.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipment.

shipment_date.description: The date when the shipment occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

carrier_name_other.description: The name of the carrier for the shipment. Provide this value only if the carrier parameter is OTHER.

notify_buyer.description: If true , sends an email notification to the buyer of the PayPal transaction. The email contains the tracking information that was uploaded through the API.

tracking_number_validated.description: Indicates whether the carrier validated the tracking number.

last_updated_time.description: The date and time when the tracking information was last updated, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

shipment_direction.description: To denote whether the shipment is sent forward to the receiver or returned back.

shipment_uploader.description: To denote which party uploaded the shipment tracking info.

tracker_collection.title: Tracker Collection
tracker_collection.description: The add tracking information for one or more transactions response details.

trackers.description: An array of tracking information for shipments.

tracker_identifier.title: Tracking Identifier
tracker_identifier.description: The tracking identifiers for a shipment.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipment.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details about the error.

batch_tracker_collection.title: Batch Tracker Collection
batch_tracker_collection.description: The add tracking information for multiple PayPal transactions response details.

tracker_identifier_collection.title: Tracker Identifier Collection
tracker_identifier_collection.description: The add tracking information for a PayPal transaction response details.
